title: Why does the cursive uppercase S look like a G? - Quora

response.answer_text: Each cursive is distinct in appearance. The problem may be that the person that created the uppercase S needs to take more care in creating the letter. They are similar in formation but the uppercase cursive G has an extra little ridge on the right side of the letter that the uppercase cursive S does not have. Hope that helps.

Only if you put it at the wrong height. A proper "two-loop" G has the top circle resting on the line, with the lower loop below the line. A hand-written upper case S can have closed loops and almost look like an ampersand; however, the entire letter is on/above the line.
